intro: Minuartia subfalcata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, lanceolate leaves. The flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. This plant is often found in tundra and mountainous areas across the Northern Hemisphere.
